data.text:
"We need to silence the guns and focus on our common enemy: the virus." 

-- @antonioguterres has called for a worldwide ceasefire. https://t.co/T5sln4KRN7

"Unless a certain percentage of population gets vaccinated, it doesn't provide community-wide protection."

— @ProfHeidiLarson of @vaccine_trust on the importance of building confidence in #COVID19 vaccines.

Learn how #VaccinesWork: https://t.co/UrxgiR7A0K https://t.co/72PHraXqNM

More than 300,000 women die from cervical cancer every year. Yet, it can be prevented through vaccinations, as well as regular screenings & treatment. 

More from @WHO during January's cervical cancer awareness month: https://t.co/S7tbydj7hV https://t.co/Cr0KGy85De

Terrorists have tried to exploit the #COVID19 crisis and to benefit from development & human rights setbacks, taking advantage of the polarization & hate speech amplified by the pandemic, @UN_OCT chief Vladimir Voronkov tells Security Council. https://t.co/Q4pIYCs8Ri

Around the world, people are spreading kindness and showing that even small acts of humanity can go a long way during the #COVID19 pandemic.
 
Find inspiring examples of solidarity in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/zuUf5FWNce

New global Ebola vaccine stockpile, led by UN agencies & humanitarian partners, will help ensure timely access to immunizations in the event of a future outbreak. 

It's a major milestone in the fight against the deadly disease. 

https://t.co/FVC8lJaUxc

Tuesday marks 11 years since we lost 102 friends & colleagues in the Haiti earthquake. 

We remember them today & always. https://t.co/xJlBF5h9pV https://t.co/P0KXhmDo1f

The UN works around the world to help the most vulnerable, including during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Season 3 of the Awake at Night podcast, hosted by @MelissaFleming, focuses on extraordinary UN staff members who devote their lives to helping others.

🎧: https://t.co/vPELSbMMTa https://t.co/OOClizGL8i

The health of the ocean will ultimately determine the survival of humankind, warns UN Ocean Envoy @ThomsonFiji, as International Decade for Ocean Science gets underway. #GlobalGoals
https://t.co/27U5YQuEFL

.@UNVolunteers are working to help some of the most vulnerable people around the world, including during the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Learn more about how you can join them and make a difference: https://t.co/RV4BHEytgS https://t.co/zITAOpkVYr

The Beirut port explosion, the #COVID19 crisis & on-going socio-economic issues have presented severe challenges for the people of Lebanon.

Here's how @WFP is helping improve the situation: https://t.co/AobfKxb6FH https://t.co/KIEa9RmzzI

"We have the opportunity to transform our world.
But to achieve this we need global solidarity, just as we need it for a successful recovery from #COVID19."

-- @antonioguterres at #COP26 Roundtable on Clean Power Transition. https://t.co/jJ7fCYD91N

Soon after little Chifundo ‘s mother passed away in Malawi, he developed malnutrition. But thanks to nutritional support from @WFP, Chifundo is getting stronger. 

More on their work to achieve #ZeroHunger: https://t.co/GjYKjKWciq

https://t.co/5Te2FesXku

New @ILO multimedia platform brings to life stories & issues affecting the world of work. 

Get unique first-person perspectives from around the world: https://t.co/aCgSk048PQ https://t.co/leNcdSB7O6

"2021 must be the year to reconcile humanity with nature."

-- @antonioguterres at Monday's @oneplanetsummit. https://t.co/xwSYwyvk8s #ClimateAction https://t.co/98pSwjOKVj

🇹🇷 Turkey 
🇨🇴 Colombia
🇵🇰 Pakistan 
🇺🇬 Uganda
🇩🇪 Germany

These five countries generously host the majority of the world's refugees.

See how @Refugees works to save lives, protect rights and build a better future for the most vulnerable. https://t.co/1zYa8o8y6x

2021 is the year for transforming food systems - and now you can take part in this global movement. 

Learn how you can become a #FoodSystemsHero: https://t.co/d9ICN4Q4uy via @FoodSystems https://t.co/8oKpRDfnHh

The Universal Declaration of Human Rights has helped improve the lives of millions of people and lay the foundations for a more just world.

Learn more about how you can #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/2ftXxLSUoQ https://t.co/p71g2Ta6dc

Climate adaptation is about
🏠homes
🚜farms
💞communities
🚦roads
👷‍♀️jobs
🍎food
💧water
🌆cities
⛑safety
and P E O P L E.

@UNFCCC explains: https://t.co/trPAdsn45m https://t.co/HTrp4LP2Wc

1 million species are in danger of extinction due to over-exploitation, the climate emergency & habitat degradation. 

Monday's @oneplanetsummit for biodiversity will help address this crisis https://t.co/Bsn1kRPxpG #ForNature https://t.co/hvNni5HzH4

"Together, I am confident that we can emerge from #COVID19 & lay the foundations for a cleaner, safer, fairer world for all & for generations to come."

-- @antonioguterres marking 75th anniversary of first #UNGA meeting. https://t.co/Ii8CYeQRll https://t.co/AEkblEhDm3

Watch live: @antonioguterres marks the 75th anniversary of the first #UNGA meeting on 10 January 1946 in London. #UN75

https://t.co/zPacZiKnl4

Coral reefs provide food, livelihoods & more for at least a billion people. But the climate crisis is threatening their existence. 

Scientists are now aiming to monitor coral reefs in real-time to protect & restore them. 

More from @UNEP:
https://t.co/NDu8DylUq2

222 public meetings & videoconferences
57 resolutions

Despite #COVID19, the work of the UN Security Council never stops. 

Have a look at highlights of its work in 2020: https://t.co/K16aELIPMH https://t.co/ba91qdeTWO

Over the past year, 1.5+ million people took part in a unique survey designed to learn more about people's hopes for the future - and how the UN can help them reach their aspirations. 

See what they had to say: https://t.co/XDQtdFxLgq #UN75 https://t.co/2P1iCfwySh

75 years ago this Sunday, the first #UNGA session took place in Central Hall, London.

More on the UN's history and our efforts to work on behalf of all people, everywhere: https://t.co/m4imamBZXI https://t.co/p2iAqoLNSd

As we prepare for the worldwide distribution of the #COVID19 vaccine, many have questions about its development, safety & more.

@UNICEF has facts about the vaccine & answers to some of the more common questions: https://t.co/t7AvkJoc0p

On 10 January 1946, the very first UN meetings were held in London.

Exactly 75 years later, you can join the "We the Peoples" conversation live with @antonioguterres. Watch this Sunday:  https://t.co/0lqJdJ1vjD #UN75 https://t.co/WVPjicpnuC

By transitioning to renewable energy & being more efficient with power consumption, the energy sector can cut greenhouse gas emissions by 12.5 gigatonnes a year. 

More #ClimateAction solutions from @UNEP: https://t.co/NTusDuImTw

1/3 of food produced is being lost or wasted, all while global hunger & food insecurity are on the rise.

See how the #COVID19 pandemic could provide an opportunity to shift toward more sustainable & resilient food systems. via @UNDP https://t.co/k56liuOn3F

Cultural & creative industries provide nearly 30 million jobs worldwide and employ more people aged 15−29 than any other sector.

2021 is the International Year of Creative Economy for Sustainable Development. https://t.co/kZim4LrX5S #GlobalGoals https://t.co/C7G3XlZi4u

Preserving our ocean & its resources protects our future. 

2021 is the start of the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development. https://t.co/xAoFd7kqA5 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Yllw5Zqy6K

People around the world have overwhelmingly expressed their faith in multilateralism to address some of the most pressing global challenges, including #COVID19 and the climate crisis.

More of what they had to say in the #UN75 survey: https://t.co/aruJo1vkan

😷 Providing personal protective equipment
📚 Supporting distance learning
💬 Offering mental health counselling

The UN is helping countries around the world tackle the #COVID19 crisis. See examples in our latest @TwitterMoments: 

https://t.co/xPeZQ73B9T

Despite #COVID19, @UNMAS experts continue working around the world to clear explosive hazards & protect people. 

Details on the UN's efforts to create a world free of the threat of landmines & unexploded ordnance: https://t.co/cA3UmvaUAV
 https://t.co/ojokyKzYTl

🍎🍊🥦 Fruits & vegetables are dietary essentials. 

Ensuring everyone has access to them is crucial in achieving food security & combatting malnutrition. 

2021 is the Int’l Year of Fruits & Vegetables. More from @FAO: https://t.co/Q8jZMHW4lI #IYFV2021 https://t.co/FHCowW5r0c

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right.

@Refugees explains why people who flee violence, war or persecution should never be sent back to a country where they are at risk of human rights violations. https://t.co/H7ytLb2Apz https://t.co/E6yN5jtRo9

Lebanon was already facing unprecedented challenges when the powerful #BeirutBlast rocked the city last year.

See how the UN continues to stand with those most affected, including by providing medical, psychological & other support. https://t.co/yyBi1i2ceQ via @UN_SDG https://t.co/c1CyS3zgFB

The UN system is gearing up to support the distribution of the #COVID19 vaccine, once available.

More on @UNmigration's work to improve immunization coverage for migrants & forcibly displaced people around the world, including during the pandemic. https://t.co/nigNQa5bdo

How can we recover our world after #COVID19? Will we return to the same ways or will we decide together that something better is possible?

Decide #ItsPossible. https://t.co/j4SVI5nQK8 https://t.co/HGZwdGpIBX

Who decides when and where a new @UNPeacekeeping operation is formed?

The Security Council decides on new missions and their mandates. Get more details here: https://t.co/yS5VxBxyfr https://t.co/b5NbsQxZWR

Democratic Republic of the Congo: @antonioguterres strongly condemns the massacre of civilians in North Kivu & calls for the perpetrators to be swiftly brought to justice.

https://t.co/6Yn2wUOJiD

UN officials express sadness following dramatic events at US Capitol in Washington, DC. 

@antonioguterres highlights importance of political leaders urging followers to refrain from violence & respect democratic processes, rule of law. https://t.co/5S3AVAjiLf

No one chooses to become a refugee. 
And everyone has the right to seek asylum. 

The 1951 Refugee Convention protects those forced to flee & helps uphold their human rights. Find out more: https://t.co/H7ytLb2Apz via @Refugees https://t.co/H4LLy5yuxK

#COVID19 has been especially devastating for women.

This year's International Women's Day in March will give special attention to the leadership role of women to achieve a more equal future & recover better from the pandemic. https://t.co/I1y0EgRfvc #IWD2021 https://t.co/ZW8NgbXamE

From supporting desperate families fleeing their homes to raising awareness about their plight, @Refugees' Boris @cheshirkov has devoted his life to helping the most vulnerable.

🎧 Listen to his story in the Awake At Night podcast with @MelissaFleming: https://t.co/ou3WCIa0I4 https://t.co/0Jr7aTyaRE

1 million+ women & men from 125 countries have served in @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world.

More on their work #ServingForPeace. https://t.co/1AkYG74EeJ #A4P https://t.co/5DEwqnA4bR

Women represent 30% of scientists around the world, yet they're often overlooked.

#WomenInScience are a critical part of our collective efforts to address the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/0pfBwIWG37 https://t.co/p3FXzxAzav

📷: The "Knotted Gun" sculpture at UNHQ is an inspirational symbol of non-violence. 

More on this iconic sculpture and its powerful message of peace & hope: https://t.co/PQykML78oq https://t.co/I00xnUAhQA

By acting early & preventively, by addressing root causes of conflict, and by speaking with one voice, the Security Council can mobilize the international community’s political & financial support, @antonioguterres said on Wednesday. https://t.co/o8xTKPxXo7

Without urgent action, hundreds of thousands of children in Yemen will die in the coming months.

As the UN works to prevent famine in the country, take a look at how doctors & nurses on the front lines are fighting to save lives. https://t.co/N613l0hYMG

Parenting is especially challenging amid #COVID19.

@UNICEF has recommendations about how to keep children safe, tips on explaining the pandemic to kids & answers to some of the most common questions about the vaccine. https://t.co/AXHvZLRliD

What we eat, and how that food is produced, affects our health but also the environment.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero by eating more sustainably -  cook more plant-based meals, buy funny-looking veggies & educate others to do the same. https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/0FY07dL1W4

.@EduCannotWait pledges $33.3 million in education resources for Burkina Faso, Mali & Niger in hopes of reaching 300,000+ children.

More on how the funding will make a difference in the lives of young people living in crisis: https://t.co/1IaNSYxqzj https://t.co/sZhpF7idDa

Unresolved gaps, inconsistencies & discrepancies raise questions about the elimination of chemical weapons in Syria, as country struggles with on-going conflict amid #COVID19, @UN_Disarmament chief @INakamitsu tells Security Council. 
https://t.co/oz0i3R6F0x

Global economy expected to expand by 4% this year, following 2020 recession.

Yet, @WorldBank warns that substantial risks remain if #COVID19 infections continue to rise & widespread rollout of vaccine is delayed. https://t.co/aTz6ays1pY

#VaccinesWork

Vaccines are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year. Yet, a growing number of networks seek to undermine trust in vaccinations.

Help share verified information that saves lives: https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/XEP3Q0W3rH

More than ever, we need solutions from the cultural & creative industries to solve the world’s biggest challenges. 

2021 is the International Year of Creative Economy for Sustainable Development. Learn more from @UNCTAD: https://t.co/ntZl92A5Lj https://t.co/2ORwCB27yI

Essential workers are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

Join us in thanking them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic. 

🎥: Hamilton-Brown London https://t.co/NziqKjfee4

Around 250,000 children have been displaced by escalating conflict in northern Mozambique and are facing devastating impacts of cyclones & #COVID19.

@UNICEF is working to protect & support displaced families in the country. https://t.co/GmkKSF8JNT https://t.co/iWCzob0fQR

The successful @unpeacekeeping / @_AfricanUnion mission in Darfur closed last week after 13 years of #ServingForPeace in Sudan. 

Details on @unamidnews' efforts to protect civilians, support the peace process & much more: https://t.co/8gpSADt5M8 https://t.co/W32rv6AlR6

"Poverty is one of the strongest things I'm concerned about, because I know how it feels to grow up in poverty."

In this episode of our Awake At Night podcast, @ZainabHawa talks to @MelissaFleming about what motivated her to devote her life to others. 🔊 https://t.co/T3cMhgeeRD https://t.co/jFpAuHMFCy

Good #Climate Action news: 
The world's first global, legally-binding measures on plastic waste are now in effect in 185 countries.

Get more details about what that means for you from @brsmeas: https://t.co/BAbQROixYA #BeatPlasticPollution https://t.co/qSEuXnM9Yb

2021 is the International Year of Health and Care Workers.

Health heroes have been key in the fight against #COVID19 and are essential to ensure #HealthForAll. We thank them for their hard work & commitment!  

More on the International Year from @WHO. https://t.co/v1wX6jACLK https://t.co/hvCBby5GoP

🇹🇷 Turkey 
🇨🇴 Colombia
🇵🇰 Pakistan 
🇺🇬 Uganda
🇩🇪 Germany

These five countries generously host the majority of the world's refugees.

See how @Refugees work to save lives, protect rights and build a better future for the most vulnerable. https://t.co/1zYa8oq8Y5

Welcome to the Security Council

🇮🇳 @IndiaUNNewYork
🇮🇪 @irishmissionun
🇰🇪 @KenyaMissionUN
🇲🇽 @MexOnu
🇳🇴 @NorwayUN

who begin their 2-year term in January.

https://t.co/jVihiER6ov https://t.co/AgLQvzrEGs

A record 235 million people worldwide will need humanitarian assistance & protection in 2021 - a 40% increase from last year, mostly due to #COVID19.

@UNOCHA's Global Humanitarian Overview highlights the urgent need to #InvestInHumanity. https://t.co/3bX57o9gE1 https://t.co/6EI5gG6jdG

#COVID19 has highlighted the importance of making essential information accessible to all. 

On Monday's #WorldBrailleDay, see how the UN helps promote Braille as a means of communication. https://t.co/e93Cr6egxn https://t.co/sx1YJkfgL5

Taking #ClimateAction and living more sustainably doesn't have to be difficult. 

The #ActNow app helps you reduce your carbon footprint - and have fun doing it. https://t.co/4i2kqgYQPL https://t.co/kyTgGphE8Z
On Monday's #WorldBrailleDay, see how braille helps blind and partially-sighted people realize their full human rights. https://t.co/sO1ETiWtON https://t.co/x1Sor62q1m

When we leave devices plugged in, they still draw power. Energy efficiency at home is crucial for protecting the environment & tackling the climate emergency.

#ActNow & unplug devices when they’re not in use. 

More #ClimateAction tips: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/kPpSb1bz9E

Braille is an essential means of communication for blind & partially-sighted people - and can help achieve the #GlobalGoals. 

Monday is #WorldBrailleDay: https://t.co/sO1ETiWtON https://t.co/FAG25xNEaj

Preserving our ocean & its resources protects our future. 

2021 is the start of the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development. https://t.co/xAoFd7kqA5 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/d7tU78ol5w

#COVID19 has dangerously stretched the capacity of countries in Latin America & the Caribbean hosting the majority of refugees & migrants from Venezuela.

The 2021 Refugee & Migrant Response plan aims to meet their evolving needs. via @refugees https://t.co/DsMx99Stff

Young #LGBTIQ+ people are more likely to experience homelessness than their peers. 

Together, we can build a world where every young person has a safe place to call home - no matter who they are or whom they love. 
https://t.co/j1uoZUzc49 via @free_equal
#endyouthhomelessness https://t.co/PIETZ2shY8

📚Learning
🌟Dreaming
🧸Playing
That's what all kids should do. 

But millions of girls & boys are trapped in child labour & #COVID19 has deteriorated the situation even further. 

2021 is the International Year to #EndChildLabour. https://t.co/EE3f6tenVi via @ILO https://t.co/29mWAVh0LP

.@UNReliefChief coordinates humanitarian responses to crises around the 🌍 for @UNOCHA.

He shares with @MelissaFleming what motivated him to devote his career to help people suffering from war, poverty & famine on our podcast 'Awake At Night'. https://t.co/OPcdN5rqcb https://t.co/xe2OG2M1Ek

The death penalty does little to serve victims or deter crime. 

170 countries have either abolished the death penalty or introduced a moratorium on its use. 

More from @UNHumanRights: https://t.co/4RfFvqhmPg #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/fdWyptV3x9
At the end of a difficult year, see the strength, solidarity and hope that emerged from 2020 in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/cq770otGyt

"The United Nations not only stands with you -- the United Nations belongs to you, and is you."

-- Secretary-General @antonioguterres. https://t.co/X8Bfn1Oy1X #UN75 https://t.co/crUyQiXUKe

1 in 3 women and girls experience violence in their lifetime -- and amid #COVID19, domestic abuse has surged worldwide.⠀
⠀
We can all do our part to support victims, starting by speaking out & sending a clear message: 'You are NOT alone'. https://t.co/xqO7tdN9re via @UN_Women https://t.co/5gz5YHs9oK

UN staff from around the world have shared their best images showcasing how we work for and with people to build a better future for everyone. 

See more in this #UN75 exhibit: https://t.co/OBMhrktCOI https://t.co/Rh9ABNh0Nt

"Working together in unity and solidarity, we will make 2021 a year of healing." -- @antonioguterres

2021 is the International Year of Peace and Trust. https://t.co/RlRnaqvJma https://t.co/QJpBn63jtH

Shifting to a green economy could yield economic gains of $26 trillion globally through 2030.

#ClimateAction is not only the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing to do. https://t.co/Nvl0LyI1N0 https://t.co/6rDLxFa5vL

Cultural & creative industries provide nearly 30 million jobs worldwide and employ more people aged 15−29 than any other sector.

2021 is the International Year of Creative Economy for Sustainable Development. https://t.co/kZim4LrX5S #GlobalGoals https://t.co/XyecwW8wGI

Fruits 🍎🍑🍊 and vegetables 🥦🥕🍆 have multiple health benefits. They can strengthen the immune system & help combat malnutrition.

2021 is the International Year of Fruits and Vegetables. More from @FAO: https://t.co/LDz8wXhRu7 #IYFV2021

https://t.co/HyOhfoq7h9

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People have spread kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

See stories from the best of humanity: https://t.co/LV9n3DX6QM

🎨: @RavenAndCrow https://t.co/woZZ9QDA5u
Tunisia assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of January. Follow @PmTunisia for updates. https://t.co/rx6vkIF1Lx https://t.co/3JhQ1fbsz7

"I firmly believe that 2021 can be a new kind of leap year — the year of a quantum leap towards carbon neutrality."

@antonioguterres has called on countries, cities, companies & individuals to join the #RaceToZero emissions. https://t.co/r4GPuCRl59 https://t.co/KDdWTNjOQ5

#HappyNewYear!

Wishing all our followers a happy, healthy and peaceful 2021. 🕊 https://t.co/LIEbXtxBli

2020 has been a year of trials, tragedies and tears. But a New Year lies ahead. And with it, we see rays of hope.

Working together in unity and solidarity, we will make 2021 a year of healing. 

-- @antonioguterres in his #NewYear2021 message. https://t.co/uTVmyvotyj

If you're out celebrating this #NewYearsEve: 

🚙 Drive safely. 
❌ Never drink and drive. 
❗️Always wear your seat belt.

#HappyNewYear https://t.co/kCaaTOyN1v

#HappyNewYear from the United Nations! 

Wishing everyone a healthy and peaceful #NewYear2021. https://t.co/4EbrkXXATP

Depression can happen to anybody.

It is an illness, not a character weakness - and it can be treated.

Get advice on how to help those who may be suffering from depression this holiday season: https://t.co/wVrUnST6XR #LetsTalk https://t.co/OQP5knFlUo

As 2020 comes to an end, see how the UN worked around the world this year to help prevent conflict, protect the most vulnerable, feed the hungry, take #ClimateAction, respond to #COVID19 & so much more. #YearInReview https://t.co/lYc35j03Wu
